• Primary Care Physician:  Dr. Robert Lee  
Chief Complaint:  
• Persistent abdominal pain and bloating for the past three weeks. History of Present Illness:  
• Onset:  Symptoms began approximately three weeks ago. • Duration:  Occurs daily, lasting throughout the day. • Character:  Described as a dull, cramping pain in the lower abdomen, with occasional sharp 
episodes. • Associated Symptoms:  Bloating, gas, and occasional nausea. • Aggravating Factors:  Consumption of certain foods, stress. • Relieving Factors:  Resting, avoiding trigger foods. • Previous Episodes:  Similar episodes in the past, usually resolved without intervention. Past Medical History:  
• Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS):  Diagnosed in 2018, managed with dietary modifications. • Seasonal Allergies:  Managed with over -the-counter antihistamines. • Surgeries:  Tonsillectomy in childhood. • Chronic Conditions:  None reported. Family History:  
• Father:  Alive, age 62 (type 2 diabetes). • Mother:  Alive, age 60 (hypertension). • Siblings:  One brother (age 30, healthy).

Medical History Report

• Name: Sarah Johnson

• Gender: Female  
• Marital Status:  Single  
• Occupation:  Teacher  
• Primary Care Physician:  Dr. Michael Brown  
Chief Complaint:  
• Severe headaches and dizziness for the past month. History of Present Illness:  
• Onset: Symptoms began approximately 30 days ago. • Duration:  Symptoms occur daily, lasting several hours. • Character:  The headache is described as throbbing, primarily located on the right side 
of the head, often accompanied by dizziness and nausea. • Associated Symptoms:  Light sensitivity, occasional vomiting, and blurred vision. • Aggravating Factors:  Stress, loud noises, and bright lights. • Relieving Factors:  Resting in a dark, quiet room, over -the-counter pain relief. • Previous Episodes:  Similar episodes occurred intermittently over the past year but have 
become more frequent and severe. Past Medical History:  
• Migraines:  Diagnosed in 2014, managed with lifestyle modifications and over -the-
counter medications. • Seasonal Allergies:  Managed with antihistamines as needed. • Surgeries:  Cholecystectomy in 2012. • Chronic Conditions:  None reported. Family History:  
• Father: Alive, age 75 (hypertension, hyperlipidemia). • Mother: Deceased at age 68 (breast cancer). • Siblings:  One sister (age 45, history of migraines).

• Alcohol:  Consumes alcohol occasionally, 1 -2 drinks per month. • Drug Use:  Denies any recreational drug use. • Exercise:  Regular yoga and walking. • Diet: Balanced diet, includes fruits, vegetables, and lean proteins. Review of Systems:  
• General:  Reports fatigue, denies weight loss or night sweats. • Skin: No rashes or lesions. • Head, Eyes, Ears, Nose, Throat (HEENT):  Denies hearing loss, sore throat, or nasal 
congestion. • Cardiovascular:  Denies chest pain, palpitations, or edema. • Respiratory:  Denies cough, shortness of breath, or wheezing. • Gastrointestinal:  Occasional nausea and vomiting related to headaches, denies other

numbness, or seizures. • Psychiatric:  Denies depression, anxiety, or other psychiatric conditions. Medications:  
• Ibuprofen 400 mg:  As needed for headache relief. • Cetirizine 10 mg:  One tablet daily during allergy season. Physical Examination:

o Blood Pressure: 125/78 mmHg
